Reviews.Title: “Average, does not live up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: UKD03
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel based on a few factors, only to be disappointed. I expected better and It is very expensive for what you get. The best thing going for the hotel us the location, It is perfect in many ways and easy to quickly get to most of the parts of Paris you want to get to. Howeverm the rooms of the hotel are lacking. The first one I was given was a strange L shaped room on the 5th floor. Very awkward feeling and just not pleasant. The room also was extremely hot with no a/c in the room. I called down to the reception to switch, they said no as they were completely sold out. That was not the case, as I was offered to pay for an upgrade. I told them they need to find another room and they called back with the upgrade. While it was bigger and a bit nicer, still just ok. The downside with all rooms you have to have the windows open, and the noise was very loud of the taxis, scooters etc going by. I felt like I couldn't win. The carpeting was a bit on the shabby side. The bathroom was dated and there was no light over the shower , so all felt very dim in the bathroom. It had an old tub with marks on the bottom. Again, expected better and by no means would I have been happy , had I paid. My suggestion is to shop around. The location is fab and can't be beat. However, just does not meet expectations. I will not return

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Polite staff”
Reviews.Author: Raven108
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. The reception is small but well presented and the receptionist was very polite. Stayed in a standard room for one night. The room is very small, which is normal for Paris. If staying here for more than one night I would go for a bigger room. The bathroom is a good size. The power from the shower is very good and the water hot - but it does need an upgrade as it is a bit dated and limescale evident. I don't think that the rooms are as nice as the Melia in Spain. The room I had was very quiet, the bed comfortable and the best thing is that you can open the windows in the bedroom. The breakfast was lovely and a very good choice - fruit, rolls, eggs, pastries, fresh fruit juice and some hot buffet choices. We had dinner in a bistro restaurant round the corner from the hotel. There are many of these near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average rooms, great location, bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: Joe R
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a bit pricey compared to what you can get elsewhere around Europe. However, that's just representative of the cost of staying in Paris. The room we got was very small (again, Paris for you) and had a view out onto a wall/the other half of the building. It was, however, clean and the bathroom was very nice with a large bath tub for relaxing after a day around the city. The hotel stored our bags on the last day as our flight did not depart until the evening which was much appreciated. The location of the hotel is ideal. You're within walking distance of the Louvre, Champs-Élysées and can hop on the metro from Concorde to get anywhere you don't feel like walking. The hotel staff are fairly knowledgable about the city and will be able to highlight on a map which metro stop you should disembark to get where. We were disappointed to be told the breakfast was a €28 per person supplement - adding to the image of the hotel as being overpriced. We had several good meals in Paris which were less so were not willing to pay so much for what looked like a fairly minimal breakfast selection.

Reviews.Title: “Would you like to upgrade?”
Reviews.Author: Bluenoser794
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable. Well presented, but probably priced a little higher than comporable hotels. A colleague and I were checking in. Recptionist to Colleague 1: Would you like to upgrade from a Standard to Premium room for an extra €40? Colleague 1: No thanks. Receptionist: Ok, well since it's your first time here we can upgrade you free of charge. Recptionist to Colleague 2: Would you like to upgrade from a Standard to Premium room? Colleague 2: C'est gratuit? Receptionist: No. Your colleague got the last free upgrade, but we can give you one for €40. Colleague 2: No thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: koala_panda
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for seeing the sights, right next to Concorde metro station, easy access to Chatelet from there. Buy your ticket before getting the train to/from airport (CDG), it's £9.25, the fine for buying a ticket on the train is £25.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: TheStylishTraveller
Reviews.Content: Hotel has an Excellent Location, very close to Concorde metro, walking distance to Rue Saint Honore, Madeleine, Opera & Louvre. Reception friendly & helpful. Comfortable Room & spacious bathroom with tub/shower. A Cosy Boutique Style Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Siandmon
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on 3 factors: first - we stayed at the excellent Melia in Palma de Mallorca last year; second – its location in Paris; and third – price. We didn’t check Tripadvisor first, because having pored over many many options for our February break to Paris, these three factors overcame our usual caution. It was a 10 minutes walk from Opera down to Rue de Cambon, along impressive shop windows when some rather welcoming windows revealed attractive furnishings within, which we thought was a plush office or maybe a designer showpiece. Very pleasantly surprised to see it was the bar/lounge of our hotel! Reception staff could not have been more pleasant or helpful. We were offered an upgrade on our room at €40 per night and when we asked what improvement that offered over the standard room we had booked, the receptionist told us the room and the bed would be bigger. I asked her how big the bed would be in the standard room: she looked it up and told us 180cm wide. That was plenty for us, so we declined the upgrade. Upstairs in our standard room we were not disappointed. The bed was plenty big enough, and very comfortable, though firm. The room was compact, but we had enough space, and the bathroom was well appointed, nicely decorated, with marble everywhere, and all the toiletries you need. At minus 3 C outside we were happy to find it very warm, though didn’t manage to reduce the temperature enough during the night for our liking. Breakfast is what we had expected it to be, based on our Mallorca experience: that is a good buffet with a fine choice of hot and cold food, and decent coffee. It was expensive at €28 a head, and was not included in our room tariff. However, we had been told the price at reception when we checked in, and, importantly, told that if we applied for a Melia club card (loyalty card) breakfast would be half price. We took the application form up to our room and decided this was well worth it, so the card was issued to us on our first night. Too early to say if there will be any spam related downsides to this., but we ticked the no publicity box so here’s hoping not. All the staff we encountered were cheerful and helpful. The location could not be better for what we wanted: near to the Tuileries Gardens and the Seine, all the places we wanted to visit were walkable. We’ll definitely stay here again the next time we come to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location! But don't leave your luggage with the concierge's desk!”
Reviews.Author: Gerda S
Reviews.Content: As a surprise for a special birthday I booked a long weekend in Paris. I selected the Melia Vendome Boutique hotel since I generally like the Melia chain. Melia Vendome is a small scale hotel, well looked after, rooms are of a reasonable size for Paris with great beds. Big problem is that it's impossible to control the heating, same - very high (25 degrees celcium) - temperature everywhere in the hotel. Rooms are fully sound-proofed, but if you think you can get some fresh air by opening a window at night, it's impossible to sleep due to noise from outside! Location is great, many interesting sites are within walking distance. Staff was welcoming and very friendly. One not so nice experience which I do want to mention just to warn new guests: don't leave anything with the concierge desk. On the day of our departure we left our 2 small suitcases and a bag with some Paris shopping with the concierge's desk. When we were in the taxi we realised that one small bag had disappeared. We claimed with the hotel, but their reply was very unsatisfactory for us: Only authorized personnel can enter the room where luggage is kept. No further explanation or apologies! So beware!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a romantic stay!”
Reviews.Author: jennieBristol
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights 24/25th January 2012 and were delighted with the location, facilities and most of all the charming staff. It was my partner's birthday and we received a complimentary bottle of fizz and fruit in our room (I had requested this beforehand but no charge was made). The staff could not have been more helpful and attentive and the bar/lounge area was a comfortable and welcome oasis of calm after the hustle and bustle of Paris. A lovely little hotel and a perfect spot to enjoy all the sights of the city and within walking distance of great bars and restaurants. We would not hesitate to stay here again and will look forward to it. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Stayed in the Grand Suite”
Reviews.Author: MikeInFLL
Reviews.Content: We were in Paris for a friend's New Year's Eve wedding. She stayed at Le Meurice (out of our price range) so we wanted something close that would allow 3 adults in the room. We ended up in the Grand Suite which was perfect. We arrived very early (about 8 am) and the room was not ready, so we went out for breakfast. Came back and the room was ready about 10:30 (although check-in, I believe, is 3 pm). Elevators are typically small; one person and their luggage or 2 persons without. Walking into the room on the 2nd floor, there is a spacious living room with TV, sofa, 2 chairs, desk and faux fireplace. Tasteful except for the odd sofa fabric. To the right is the bath (marble, combination tub and shower, dual sinks). Excellent water pressure. Tub too small for a bath. No bidet. A roll-away was set up against the windows (no view to speak of). Around the corner is the bedroom. King bed, great mattress and linens. Decent closet (no drawers), mini safe. Ipod dock/stereo was appreciated. It was very expensive, but it was NYE. Three nights averaged about 575 Euro per night, plus about 50 Euro for the extra person per night. We rolled in on the morning of New Year's Day at 7 am exactly as the buffet was opening. We had a split of Champagne and they did not seem to charge us for the meal (unless I paid cash and didn't charge it to the room; my memory of that morning is hazy). Beautiful meats, cheeses, fruits, juices, breads and made to order omelettes. As we returned home at about midnight the last night, we were all in our beds, talking, and we got a call from the front desk asking us to be quiet. Walls may be a little thin. Service was always pleasant. They always had an umbrella for us, happily kept our bags, and immediately responded to my email request for a copy of the bill after I was home. The bill is in a combination of French and Spanish, so I had trouble understanding it but figured it out. If I were choosing again, I would take a hotel in a less posh area and save the money. The location is amazing, but for me, it's not necessary to stay there as it's so easy to get around Paris.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel made my vacation”
Reviews.Author: Dana F
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at room 404. Fantastic, kind, attentive staff, with a professional attitude and smile. It was a pleasure to come into the cozy lobby from the cold. The room was comfortable, and the matrass as well as the sheets were delicious. Location is excellent as well

Reviews.Title: “Location can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: discover124
Reviews.Content: As several other reviewers mention, the location of the hotel is oustanding. We could walk to many major sights and a metro stop is nearby. While in a central spot, noise in the room was not a problem as the hotel is located on a side street. It's surrounded by the high-end shopping of Place Vendome area and is on the same street as the entrance to the Hemingway Bar at the Ritz. The common areas of the hotel were lovely and we found the staff to be welcoming. The front desk staff was helpful in making a restaurant reservation for us and with calling for taxis. We did not eat breakfast in the hotel but did find the service to be oustanding in the bar. The size of our room was small (but in-line with most in Paris) and a bit dark. However, it was very clean and comfortable, and we were able to use the mini-bar refridgerator to store our own drinks/snacks. There is a small market a few blocks from the hotel on St. Honore. We also found some nice cafes/brasseries on the streets around the hotel. We've stayed in several other hotels in Paris in the same class range in various locations, and this ranks among the best for location and service. One area for improvement, however, is the lack of wifi availability in the room and the fee charged by the hotel for wifi acess in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, sweet staff”
Reviews.Author: KDuke7
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here with my son; my nth trip to Paris, his first. This is my favorite hotel I have stayed at in Paris since it beautifully accommodates my top 3 needs: Great central Location, Value for money and CLEAN. My baby son is now 22 and 6'6, and he often finds Euro hotel rooms a squeeze--but not the Melia Vendome--his room ( mine was identical) was a decent size (esp. for Paris) the bathrooms were sparkly, marble and very large. The ladies at the front desk were multi-lingual beauties who added to the sparkly beauty of the hotel, as well as being kind and helpful. Tons of restos, great shopping, and easy walking to all the delights of the city. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT location, Amazing Breakfast Buffet!”
Reviews.Author: NYC_27
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a standard 4 star European hotel with rooms that are small, but typical for this type of Europe and of hotels in this price range. The rooms were clean, well furnished and adequate, though the beds could be a bit more comfortable. As is typical in many European hotels the beds are often very hard and lacking in blankets, down comforters, etc. The real highlight of this hotel is its amazing location on the Rue Cambon (just next to the best shopping in Paris, the Louvre, the Place Vendome and all the beautiful sights of the 1st Arrondisment). In addition, the breakfast buffet (whcih is included in certain room rates) is AMAZING. The hotel is a Melia, which is a Spanish chain, so the breakfast featured lots of Spanish favorites such as tortilla de patatas, churros, and serrano ham in addition to the most amazing French hot chocolate and croissants! Breakfast was so good that I often filled up so much at breakfast that I needed to skip lunch! This hotel is a perfect place to stay in Paris. The price is much more reasonable than most hotels in this very posh area of Paris and the location is fantastic. The service was also excellent and the amenities were absolutely adequate for this type of hotel. I have stayed in some of the best hotels in Paris (Le Meurice, Le Crillon, The Ritz) and while this hotel is clearly not of that caliber, it is a very solid and comfortable option for your next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in heart of Paris.”
Reviews.Author: Equeria
Reviews.Content: This is a charming hotel with lovely rooms and a friendly staff. Rooms are standard European size. It is in a fantastic location. Lots of shoppng and cafes nearby. Close to Church Madaleine, the old Paris Opera House, Concord Plaza and the Louvre. Metro is just a couple blocks away. I would definitely return here on my next trip to Paris. My only complaint was that there as no wireless in the room (Ethernet only) and Internet is not included in the price of the room ($15/day). Also, the breakfast was not included and I heard it was expensive. We didn't try it, because there was a lovely cafe a couple blocks of the hotel . We just stopped there on our way out sightseeing each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it, 1 of best locations!, expensive breakfast!!!”
Reviews.Author: romvf
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week as the first stop on our two week european vacation. Upon arrival the front desk staff (And everyone except one guy vacuuming the stairs) spoke English well and got us checked in quickly. When you get to your room (at least in Paris and Rome) the air conditioning will not be on super cool,and it wasn't super pleasant to have the room warm after walking a few blocks from the metro (but if you take a taxi they aren't super air conditioned either [ compared to the USA]). You have to leave your room key in a special power outlet that allows the lights and power to be on when you are in it. We got super lucky and the person before us left theirs so we were able to leave and return to a cool room. Ask for a second or extra room key so that you can do this too. It shouldn't be a problem unless you are traveling alone. The room had a view of the street, but it wasn't bad, I actually still enjoyed looking out the window. This hotel is one block from the Tuilieries garden but does not have a view of it. We noticed the Westin a couple blocks away had tons of rooms facing the Tullieries if you really want a room with a view, that hotel would probably be better. We were very happy with the value of the hotel (except for breakfast) and paid $200/night thursday-saturday nights. The location is perfect for walking to all of Paris. We are late 20s and fine walking 4-5 miles a day, or taking the Metro to the further places. But overall I can't really imagine a hotel with a better location for the price. As I said above, the Westin is a couple blocks away with a better view, but probably costs a lot more. Our one major qualm with the hotel is the breakfast. The literature says something like "come join us for breakfast" and we took that to mean free. When we got there it was a buffet like most free hotel buffets, so that added to my belief that it was free. There was NO SERVICE whatsoever, they showed us to a table and then as we were up getting food, dropped off a check. It costs 56 euros, or about $75 USD! Yes, the breakfast was great, but we certainly would not have eaten it if we had known it was so expensive. Any food the hotel has to offer is this exorbitantly priced. A Heineken at the bar is ten euros, unless it is happy hour (which is tuesday night) then it is five euros. The minibar prices are even worse. I think a single drink of gordon's gin would have been 13 euros. There were also some food items that were 10. We even took the minibar menu with us to show our friends. (Because we thought it was amazingly funny! Who would ever pay such prices?!) Overall I would recommend staying here, especially for the price and location. Just don't eat their food.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT LOCATION, VERY ATMOSPHERIC HOTEL, MOST HELPFULL STAFF”
Reviews.Author: nmpal13
Reviews.Content: It is a fantasctic location if you like to walk the city. It is only 3' walk from the metro of Concorde, and you can just walk to the Luvre museum. Very clean hotel with specious rooms and a " retro & romantic" atmosphere. The staff was very helpfull, i surelly recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Quite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pkowis
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to get this hotel. I say that because we had never been to it before. The street names are hard to find in the dark but the street it is right across the street from the tube. Everyone was extremely nice and helpful with directions. One thing I did not know was that yes they have air conditioning but not in March. The room was warm but open the window and it was nice, The other tip to know is that when you go into the rooms none of the light switches work unless you put your room card into the wall. My husband had 2 jaunts to the desk. We laugh now. This hotel has a very small elevator for 2 people with each a bag. We had a room with a queen size bed and that took most of the room. The neighborhood is very close to the Opra House a very trendy area.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location-worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: GJW8
Reviews.Content: The Melia Vendome is in a great location, just walk out the front door , turn left and there is the Jardin De Tullieres!!! The rooms are comfortable and well-furnished with a nice bathroom and the bed was tres cosy. The hotel staff were lovely and very helpful. It's worth spending a bit extra on a hotel when you visit Paris-it makes all the difference to your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but very small”
Reviews.Author: eddala2004
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent 3 nights in Paris on a "Back to our roots" trip and decided on this hotel due to the good price and the place where it is situated. From the Hotel you can walk to almost everywhere. The Hotel itself is clean and nice but the rooms and especially the beds are very small. But the bathroom is quite big compared to the rest of the room. Our room was situated on the 2nd floor and the window was directed to the inner circle. What I missed was WLan. The staff is friendly and knows how to help. I would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and most comfortable bed of the trip”
Reviews.Author: DebOChicago_IL Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on Priceline--otherwise we'd never have been able to afford to stay in this elegant neighborhood just a couple blocks from the Tuileries. This hotel offers a really beautiful lobby and pleasant, attentive service from front desk and bell staff. Our room was not large, but comfortable, with a really beautiful bathroom, and a large window overlooking the street. The bed was excellent: firm and dressed with quality linens. It was so comfortable that I wished we were staying longer so I could sleep in it more! On the down side, it's a luxury hotel, so amenities are expensive. Wired internet in the room was expensive. Even using the computer in the lobby was expensive. My husband and I each ordered a cup of coffee in the morning, which we drank in the lobby--the check was 10 euros. Still, we'd stay there again if we had the chance. Oh, that bed! And the location is really hard to beat. Two blocks to the Tuileries; a slow 30 minute stroll to St. Germain. A couple of blocks beyond Place Vendome are many reasonable brasseries and cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, needs to be refreshed a bit”
Reviews.Author: Ulysse78
Reviews.Content: The best point of this hotel it's the location. 5 minutes by walk from the Louvre adn Place de la Concorde and 5 minutes from Rivoli Street adn Faubourg St-Honoré. The nearest Metro station is at not even 5 minutes, station Concorde. The hotel is proposing small rooms for a 4 stars and they need to be refresh soon cause it's more turning now into a 3 stars quality rooms. The wallpaper is having a little bit of mold, carpets are little dirty and the bed is not too much comfortable. Rooms are well decorated but a little bit taky. There is only one restaurant proposing international menu and the same restaurant is offering the breakfast in the morning. Beside this, there are no other services, no gym, no swimming pool. I f you able to request a street view, this the nicest view that you could have or else with will be the interior court. This is a OK hotel

Reviews.Title: “A First Class Service”
Reviews.Author: Carra9Southport
Reviews.Content: Having stayed annually at other hotels within Paris for the previous six years, our stay at the Melia Vendome proved to be a very surprising and most enjoyable stay. All the staff members were extremely helpful and courteous while the accomodation and service itself was of an exceptional standard. In terms of location, the rooms overlooking Rue Cambon are superb for 'people watching' during the evening while restaurants within the immediate area are both very popular and accommodating of families with young children (providing, of course that your children are well behaved!) In all, a superb hotel in an excellent location- highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “This was the most dreadful hotel we have ever stayed in. None of its promises are accurate.”
Reviews.Author: loisgord
Reviews.Content: During a heatwave in Paris, there was no airconditioning, as advertised. My husband and I had paid beforehand via hotels.com, so we could not get a refund. We spent four sleepless nights (Everyone was leaving after they discovered this and had NOT pre-paid), and were supposed to return there (after Italy) for the last two. Fortunately we got to stay at an airconditioned hotel at the end. We lost an enormous amount of money. . . and time, which is priceless. The hotel advertises a business center. There is one computer in the public area. People wait, but to no avail, since there is always someone sitting there who has paid for at least an hour's usage. They advertise the usual amenities. To my mind, this does not mean thin, cheap towels and the absence of the usual toiletries (cream, shower cap). The hotel advertises (I've forgetten the word) television that is comprehensive. They had only the local French stations, not even CNN! (Perhaps there was one German station). It was terribly frustrating to ask when? will the a/c be repaired and to be told, "tonight," "tomorrow," etc. (I wonder if it is cold there in the winter!) There is no excuse for a hotel to be run in this fashion. You could not literally pay me to return there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, location and service!”
Reviews.Author: londoneyes
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel during my great last minute deal for midweek break at the end of March, which was still a bit cold but still enjoyed my stay. Located in a very stylish part of Paris, close to the metro, river, cafes & restaurant, La Place Vendome where the Ritz is and plenty of expensive shops and boutiques. This is a quiet elegant hotel: lovely spacious rooms and very nice marble bathrooms (some with shower, some with bath) and very comfy beds. However, beware of the interconnecting rooms as the noise travels through those doors..I had to put up with a 15 min row over money by an American couple, amusing though... There is a computer in the lobby, if you need to use the internet (but mind the crazy keyboard), €4 for 30mins. I did not have the hotel breakfast as it is a bit overpriced but there's plenty of choice of bars to have your breakfast in. Overall, I was most pleased with this hotel and their staff and will be coming back later this year.

Reviews.Title: “Your Euro won't go far here....”
Reviews.Author: Canonicals
Reviews.Content: Positives: Wonderful location, clean, comfortable, well appointed bathrooms, helpful staff Negatives: - room far too warm and using the thermostat made absolutely no difference - absence of drawers to unpack into - as other reviewers oft comment - 'extras' prices very high - breakfast, minibar, broadband - all extortionate Thankfully, there are quite a few free wi-fi locations around Paris and breakfast could be taken at a reasonable price in nearby eateries.

Reviews.Title: “I got treated like a criminal”
Reviews.Author: glamourVIP
Reviews.Content: My first experience with this hotel took place a few years back when I stayed at the Melia Vendome for a week. I found the room smallish and not decorated with the level of sophistication one would expect from a Paris boutique hotel. My room faced rue Mont-Thabor and every morning there were incredibly noisy deliveries to the hotel basement beneath my window. The bedcovers were made of cheap material that spread white lint all around. Service was unremarkable. There was one silly incident when, during a weekend, I informed the receptionist that a lightbulb had gone out in my room. She answered that a technician would fix it next monday earliest! I even offered to replace it myself. Finally an experienced maid appeared and took care of the matter. After this I decided to try more expensive hotels in Paris and I've had wonderful experiences at Four Seasons George V, La Trémoille, Pershing Hall and Lancaster (where the service is really superb). My experience turned real sour last week when I was walking past the Melia Vendome and felt the need of a gents' room. As soon as I stepped into the lobby (dressed neatly in French designer brands) an enraged porter started shouting at me MONSIEUR! I enquired politely about the toilet and he continued yelling aggressively: "It is not possible because you don't have a room here". That's right, I didn't - and never again will. Are restaurant patrons banned from the toilet as well? I realize that the hotel may choose whatever policy they want but I fail to see the business sense in alienating clients from the hotel and, quite easily, from the entire Melia brand. Safest to keep away .

Reviews.Title: “This place is highly satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: RetiredKentucky
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Paris and a short two night stay at the Melia Vendome. The location of this hotel is perfect for sightseeing and for catching the Metro. We were treated wonderfully by the staff upon arrival and the porter talked us through how to use the heat and other things about the room. The room was larger than most in Paris and frankly better appointed than many in Paris and London. The bathroom ammenities were excellent. That said, no washcloths were provided. The staff was most helpful. On my request they called and confirmed our car to CDG Airport. They all spoke English, including the restaurant staff. I would recommned this hotel to friends and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Poorly maintained, bad service, horrible experience... Not a boutique hotel at a”
Reviews.Author: paris-loverr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Melia Vendome for 10 days recently (Nov 2007) and came back very disappointed with the hotel facilities and overall service. Let me just start by saying that on our second night we were awaken by a couple of mice that were trying to binge on some the flakes of a left over croissant (the bag was in a trash can). After making the front desk aware of this situation, they responded as lazily as if I had just requested an extra set of sheets. The rooms (we tried 2 different ones) are poorly ventilated and have no air conditioning. You need to keep the windows open almost the entire time or the room will quickly get warm. And since we were afraid of mice jumping in from an open window, we just were uncomfortable the whole time. The hotel had two very claustrophobic elevators that could fit two people very tightly (almost like touching each other). So you wouldn’t want to take the elevator with a stranger. One of elevators seemed to be broken and did not go to our floor (the 5th floor) so we had to go to the 6th and walk down one floor. One evening, we headed down to relax in the small, dark, bar lounge of the hotel and also came away very disappointed. Service was very mediocre at best. Wine/aperitif selection very poor. They did not have a Dubonet or Lille for us to try… I mean you are in Paris at a hotel situated a few blocks away from La Madeleine, Louvre Museum, … The Spanish-speaking staff is somewhat uncompromising and very unattentive. You need to basically stress what you need/want for them to pay attention. There's no concierge or any type of guide other than the standard, often-low-quality set of tourist brochures.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Mandarin
Reviews.Content: I agree with the favorable review of this hotel posted May 15, 2007. I spent more time than usual searching for an acceptable hotel in Paris. Most of the 4* hotels I considered offered good deals on their websites, which I would recommend checking out, in addition to the major travel gateway sites you normally do. That said, the hotels seem to release their inventory to consolidators at about one month out, so if you wait too long in anticipation of a last-minute price drop, you’ll end up with zero availability (and higher prices, for some reason). My (standard) room was on the first floor (above the lobby), which I liked because it was accessible by stairway. The elevators are *really* small and not particularly fast, and if I stayed there again, I would definitely request a room I could walk to. The room was basic but not at all shabby and certainly above satisfactory…but not luxurious. It was small, but not tiny, and very clean. Closet space was more than sufficient, but it needed to be since the room had no dresser. The bathroom was larger than one would expect, and well-appointed…lots of marble. Three complaints. First, I could never get the heater to work. Second, completely separate from the bathroom, the toilet has its own incredibly cramped room that is not designed for anyone taller than six feet. Finally, an Internet connection will run you €23/day; I found this expensive compared to the other hotels I had researched. The hotel staff deserves special mention. Without exception, they were friendly, helpful, professional and polite. Their English was better than my French. In my opinion, the Melia Vendome is a 3½-star property (a notch closer to four than three, though), and I would happily stay there again. The hotel is ideally located in what I feel is the best tourist area in Paris, because it is both upscale and perfectly centered. With cooperative weather, you can walk to most of the places you’re likely to visit. Or you can take the metro: Concorde and Madeleine are each just 2-3 (short) blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “All the right stuff”
Reviews.Author: Schnoodles
Reviews.Content: Hotel Melia Vendome was a fabulous place for us to spend our week in Paris. We were concerned about some of the reviews being dated back to 2005, therefore, we are submitting our recent experience. The location of this hotel is superb. Very close to the Place de la Concorde and the Concorde metro station. This is in the 1er arrondissement/district, close to all the wonder of metro Paris. Every day, we were able to see the view of the major sights of Paris - the arc de Triumphe, Eiffel Tower, Obelisk and fountains as we went to and fro from the metro. At the end of a full day with tired feet, it was great to have the hotel so close. We were in room 516, streetside. We asked for a non-smoking room. Very traditional lovely decor and a nice sized bathroom. Being in the city, the traffic noises were heard when we opened the windows in this unseasonably warm Spring. However, it was virtually soundproof with the windows closed. Since we were there before the air conditionaing was activated, we kept the windows cracked. We will always remember hearing the beautiful choral music on Good Friday floating through the air from the nearby church. The staff was very cordial and helpful at all times, and our fears of not speaking French were set aside immediately. We grabbed our coffee and croissant breakfast around the corner rather than eat in the hotel, so can't comment on the restaurant. The elevators are the world's smallest, but we never had a problem with coming and going as needed. We would definitely stay at the Melia Vendome again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: batw
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel in a great location. A boutique Spanish chain hotel - rooms are not large, but decor, furnishing etc throughout are first class. Staff are extremely friendly and helpful. Room service was provided well out of normal hours.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Odd”
Reviews.Author: Pepe-le-Pew
Reviews.Content: What an odd place! Great location and nice staff, good buffet breakfast, but who decided that travelers didn't need a chest of drawers to unpack. Nothing. Zip. The rooms are small, though the bathrooms are large. We were upgraded to a junior suite--still nowhere to unpack. I could think of worse places to stay, particularly at the bargains offered in the winter this year, but they certainly don't know how to make you feel at home in your room!

Reviews.Title: “Not suitable for family”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good location and small but a nice room. This hotel has the smallest lift I ever experienced(it fitted only 3 people). We requested a cot in our room, but it was not in our room and they could not arrange for some reason they could not explain. No housekeeper at night so I would say 3 star hotel rather than 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable luxury in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: 1KViajeroMundial
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. Just two blocks from the Concorde metro stop, the hotel affords an extremely strategic location in the heart of Paris in which to branch out and attack the city of lights. Also one block from the Ritz / Place Vendome. Very luxurious lobby and rooms. I stayed there on two separate occasions (but on the same European trip), once at the beginning for 3 nights and once at the end of the trip. The first three nights were in a suite (due to hotel overbooking error) and was, of course, very well appointed. The last night was in a standard room which was every bit as nice as the suite (only lacking the double bathroom and extra space).The lobby is very pristine with fresh flowers and various sitting areas. The bar is very posh with wood paneling on the walls giving it a very clubbish feel. The breakfast buffet and eating areas was very generous and included in the room rate. The rate relative to the amenities, accomodations and location made this hotel an absolute bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from 24th Oct 2003 to 26th Oct 2003 and it was beautiful. All the staff were very friendly, the breakfasts were delicious, the service we received was wonderful and the location was great - about 10 mins walk from Champs Elysees! The bedrooms were small, but very very clean. The bathroom had marble floors and walls and again very clean, we could no complaints about the accommodation. We booked over the internet (not direct with the hotel) and was told that it included breakfast... but when we were checking out we were informed that it wasn't - so we had to pay an extra £35 (for two people per day) - so be careful and get written confirmation from whoever your booking with!! We had a fantastic time and would recommend it - we would certainly go back.
